metadata.description: Not used, but needed to pass arm-ttk test `Location-Should-Not-Be-Hardcoded`.  We instead use the `workspace-location` which is derived from the LA workspace
[concat('Region to deploy solution resources -- separate from location selection',parameters('location'))]
Workspace name for Log Analytics where Microsoft Sentinel is setup

properties.description: Infoblox NIOS data connector with template version 3.0.3

connectorUiConfig.title: Infoblox NIOS
connectorUiConfig.descriptionMarkdown: The [Infoblox Network Identity Operating System (NIOS)](https://www.infoblox.com/glossary/network-identity-operating-system-nios/) connector allows you to easily connect your Infoblox NIOS logs with Microsoft Sentinel, to view dashboards, create custom alerts, and improve investigation. This gives you more insight into your organization's network and improves your security operation capabilities.
connectorUiConfig.additionalRequirementBanner: These queries are dependent on a parser based on a Kusto Function deployed as part of the solution.

sampleQueries.description: Total Count by DHCP Request Message Types
sampleQueries.query:
union isfuzzy=true 
 Infoblox_dhcpdiscover,Infoblox_dhcprequest,Infoblox_dhcpinform 
| summarize count() by Log_Type

Infoblox_dnsclient 
 | summarize count() by SrcIpAddr 
 | top 10 by count_ desc

dataTypes.name: Syslog (InfobloxNIOS)
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
Infoblox 
            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

value:
Infoblox 
 | where TimeGenerated > ago(3d)
 |take 1 
 | project IsConnected = true

customs.name: Infoblox NIOS
customs.description: must be configured to export logs via Syslog

instructionSteps.description: **NOTE:** This data connector depends on a parser based on a Kusto Function to work as expected which is deployed as part of the solution. To view the function code in Log Analytics, open Log Analytics/Microsoft Sentinel Logs blade, click Functions and search for the alias Infoblox and load the function code or click [here](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/master/Solutions/Infoblox%20NIOS/Parser/Infoblox.yaml), on the second line of the query, enter any unique identifiers for the logstream. The function usually takes 10-15 minutes to activate after solution installation/update.

Typically, you should install the agent on a different computer from the one on which the logs are generated.

>  Syslog logs are collected only from **Linux** agents.

parameters.title: Choose where to install the agent:

instructionSteps.title: Install agent on Azure Linux Virtual Machine
instructionSteps.description: Select the machine to install the agent on and then click **Connect**.

instructionSteps.title: Install agent on a non-Azure Linux Machine
instructionSteps.description: Download the agent on the relevant machine and follow the instructions.

instructionSteps.title: 1. Install and onboard the agent for Linux

instructionSteps.description:
Configure the facilities you want to collect and their severities.
 1. Under workspace advanced settings **Configuration**, select **Data** and then **Syslog**.
 2. Select **Apply below configuration to my machines** and select the facilities and severities.
 3.  Click **Save**.
instructionSteps.title: 2. Configure the logs to be collected

instructionSteps.description: [Follow these instructions](https://www.infoblox.com/wp-content/uploads/infoblox-deployment-guide-slog-and-snmp-configuration-for-nios.pdf) to enable syslog forwarding of Infoblox NIOS Logs. Use the IP address or hostname for the Linux device with the Linux agent installed as the Destination IP address.
instructionSteps.title: 3. Configure and connect the Infoblox NIOS

instructionSteps.description: Update the watchlist 'Sources_by_Source' with the hostname(s) of your Infoblox device(s). Set SourceType to 'InfobloxNIOS' and Source to the value of 'Computer' seen in the logs seen in Syslog table.
instructionSteps.title: 4. Configure the Sentinel parser

metadata.description:
Gain insight into Infoblox NIOS by analyzing, collecting and correlating DHCP and DNS data.
This workbook provides visibility into DHCP and DNS traffic

properties.description:
@{workbookKey=InfobloxNIOSWorkbook; logoFileName=infoblox_logo.svg; description=Gain insight into Infoblox NIOS by analyzing, collecting and correlating DHCP and DNS data.
This workbook provides visibility into DHCP and DNS traffic; dataTypesDependencies=System.Object[]; dataConnectorsDependencies=System.Object[]; previewImagesFileNames=System.Object[]; version=1.1.0; title=Infoblox NIOS; templateRelativePath=Infoblox-Workbook-V2.json; subtitle=; provider=Infoblox}.description
This creates an incident in the event a client generates excessive amounts of DNS queries for non-existent domains.
properties.query:
let threshold = 200;
Infoblox_dnsclient
| where isnotempty(DnsResponseCode)
| where DnsResponseCode =~ "NXDOMAIN"
| summarize count() by SrcIpAddr, bin(TimeGenerated,15m)
| where count_ > threshold
| join kind=inner (Infoblox_dnsclient
    | where isnotempty(DnsResponseCode)
    | where DnsResponseCode =~ "NXDOMAIN"
    ) on SrcIpAddr
| extend timestamp = TimeGenerated, IPCustomEntity = SrcIpAddr

properties.description: This creates an incident in the event that an excessive amount of DHCPREQUEST have been recieved by a DHCP Server and could potentially be an indication of a DHCP Starvation Attack.
properties.query:
let threshold = 1000;
Infoblox
| where ProcessName =~ "dhcpd" and Log_Type =~ "DHCPREQUEST"
| summarize count() by SrcIpAddr, bin(TimeGenerated,5m)
| where count_ > threshold
| join kind=inner (Infoblox
    | where ProcessName =~ "dhcpd" and Log_Type =~ "DHCPREQUEST"
    ) on SrcIpAddr
| extend timestamp = TimeGenerated, IPCustomEntity = SrcIpAddr

properties.description: The watchlist is used by parsers to specify Sources and their types.

properties.descriptionHtml:
Note: Please refer to the following before installing the solution:

• Review the solution Release Notes

• There may be known issues pertaining to this Solution, please refer to them before installing.

The Infoblox Network Identity Operating System (NIOS) solution for Microsoft Sentinel enables you to easily connect your Infoblox NIOS logs with Microsoft Sentinel, to view dashboards, create custom alerts, and improve investigation. This gives you more insight into your organization's network and improves your security operation capabilities.

Underlying Microsoft Technologies used:

This solution takes a dependency on the following technologies, and some of these dependencies either may be in Preview state or might result in additional ingestion or operational costs:

  1. Agent-based log collection (Syslog)

Data Connectors: 1, Workbooks: 1, Analytic Rules: 2, Watchlists: 1

Learn more about Microsoft Sentinel | Learn more about Solutions
